titlestmt.titleproper: Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 3, Accession 2017:059
A Guide to the Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 3, Accession 2017:059 FA1410

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-08-28 00:05:40 -0400.

did.unittitle: Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 3, Accession 2017:059

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Henry Luce Foundation was established by Henry R. Luce in 1936. As a New York-based nonprofit organization, the Luce Foundation awards grants in American Art, Asian studies, Higher Education, Theology, and supports the Clare Boothe Luce Program for women in science, mathematics, and engineering.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by the Henry Luce Foundation in 2017.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC holds legal title. The Henry Luce Foundation retains all applicable intellectual property rights in so far as it holds them.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 1, Accession 2017:057 (FA1317)
Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 2, Accession 2017:058 (FA1393)
Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 4, Accession 2017:060 (FA1442)
Henry Luce Foundation records, Record Group 5, Accession 2017:061 (FA1472)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henry Luce Foundation records (Record Group 3) contain grant files and information on projects supported by the Luce Fund for Asian Studies.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Henry Luce Foundation records (Record Group 3) are arranged as follows:
Series 2: Luce Fund for Asian Studies, 1975-2013

Luce Fund for Asian Studies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Luce Fund for Asian Studies awarded grants to foster the study of Asia in American liberal arts colleges. This series contains grant files from the program's inception in 1999 through its final grant competition in 2002. Also included are a series of grants that predate the official establishment of the Luce Fund for Asian Studies which show the Foundation's early support for broadening Asian studies in American universities.
